post.description: Allows an administrator to create transactions between users, or between a user and the system. Multiple transaction requests can be batched. Operations are atomic (all or nothing). It is strongly recommended to include an 'X-Idempotency-Key' header for safe retries.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Optional (but recommended) idempotency key to prevent duplicate processing of the same request. Any string can be used (e.g., a UUID or a nanoid).

200.description: Virtual transactions created successfully. Returns all generated ledger entries.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid input, validation error (e.g., invalid user IDs, inconsistent source/destination), or other processing error.

404.description: Not Found - Referenced entity (e.g., userId, virtualCurrencyId) not found.

409.description: Conflict - Potential duplicate request based on idempotency key and request content. Another cause could be that at least one of the operations would conflict with a user's counterpart boundary (minAllowedBalance or maxAllowedBalance)

MissionAssignment.description: Represents the assignment of a mission to a user or a group.

missionAssignmentId.description: Unique identifier for the mission assignment (NanoID).

missionRuleId.description: Optional. Identifier of the mission rule that triggered this assignment.

periodId.description: Identifier for the specific period of a recurring mission assignment.

timeframeType.description: The timeframe type of this assignment.

startsAt.description: Start date-time of this mission assignment.

endsAt.description: Optional. End date-time of this mission assignment (for RANGE and RECURRING).

completedAt.description: Optional. Timestamp when the mission assignment was completed.

isCompleted.description: Indicates if the mission assignment is completed.

state.description: Current state of the mission assignment.

groupTagId.description: Required if missionType is 'GROUP'. The tag ID of the assigned group.

userId.description: Required if missionType is 'INDIVIDUAL'. The ID of the assigned user.

currentAmount.description: Current progress amount towards the target.

targetAmount.description: Target amount required for mission completion.

incrementExpression.description: JSON Logic expression defining how progress is incremented for this assignment. Evaluated against: `{ event }` (where event is the specific entity like Activity, Quiz, or Tag that triggered the evaluation).

targetAmountExpression.description: JSON Logic expression defining the target amount for this assignment. Evaluated against: `{ mission, user? }` (user is optional and only present for INDIVIDUAL missions).

accountId.description: The account ID associated with this assignment.

workspaceId.description: The workspace ID associated with this assignment.

sourceRegion.description: AWS region where this assignment was created.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the assignment was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the assignment was last updated.

CreateMissionAssignmentRequest.description: Data required to manually create a mission assignment.

userId.description: Required if missionType is 'INDIVIDUAL'. The ID of the user to assign the mission to.

groupTagId.description: Required if missionType is 'GROUP'. The tag ID of the group to assign the mission to.

missionType.description: Type of the mission being assigned.

missionId.description: Identifier of the mission to assign.

startsAt.description: Start date-time for this manual assignment.

endsAt.description: Optional. End date-time for this manual assignment (required if timeframeType is 'RANGE').

currentAmount.description: Optional. Initial progress amount. Defaults to 0.

targetAmount.description: Optional. Overrides the mission's targetAmountExpression if provided.

timeframeType.description: Timeframe type for this manual assignment. 'RECURRING' is not allowed for manual assignments.

MissionRule.description: Defines rules for automatically assigning missions to users or groups.

missionRuleId.description: Unique identifier for the mission rule (NanoID).

missionType.description: Type of missions this rule assigns (individual or group).

groupTagId.description: Required if missionType is 'GROUP'. The tag ID identifying the target group.

usersMatchCondition.description: Required if missionType is 'INDIVIDUAL'. JSON Logic to filter users. Evaluated against: `{ user }`.

missionsPool.description: Optional pool of mission IDs from which to select.

missionsMatchCondition.description: JSON Logic to select missions from the pool or all available missions. Every mission is evaluated singularly. Evaluated against: `{ mission }`.

timeframeType.description: Defines the active period of the rule. Please note that 'PERMANENT' should be used only on one-time missions, since they cannot be assigned again after the first time

timeframeTimezoneType.description: Determines if the timeframe uses a fixed timezone or the user's timezone.

timeframeTimezone.description: Required if timeframeTimezoneType is 'FIXED'. The IANA timezone string.

timeframeStartsAt.description: Start date-time of the rule's active period.

timeframeEndsAt.description: Required for 'RANGE' and 'RECURRING' timeframeTypes. End date-time.

recurrence.description: Required for 'RECURRING' timeframeType. How often the rule recurs.

scheduleCron.description: Required if recurrence is 'CUSTOM' or assignmentMode is 'SCHEDULED_PUSH'. Cron expression for scheduling.

assignmentMode.description: How missions are assigned by this rule. LAZY would cause missions to be assigned (if applicable) every time a user requests its own missions. EVENT based assignments allows assigning missions in response to other events. Please note that SCHEDULED_PUSH is not supported at the moment, and will be supported in the future.

state.description: Current operational state of the rule.

missionRuleCatalogId.description: ID from catalog if origin is 'CATALOG'.

syncWithCatalog.description: Whether to sync with catalog updates.

eventMatchType.description: Required for 'EVENT' assignmentMode. Type of event matching.

eventMatchEntity.description: Required for 'EVENT' assignmentMode. Entity involved in the event.

eventMatchEntityId.description: Required for 'EVENT' assignmentMode. Specific ID of the event entity.

eventMatchCondition.description: Required for 'EVENT' assignmentMode. JSON Logic for event conditions. Evaluated against: `{ event }` (where event is the specific entity like Activity, Quiz, Tag, or User that triggered the evaluation).

accountId.description: The account ID that owns this mission rule.

workspaceId.description: The workspace ID that contains this mission rule.

sourceRegion.description: AWS region where the mission rule was created.

stage.description: Current publication stage of the mission rule.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the mission rule was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the mission rule was last updated.

VirtualCurrency.description: Virtual currency entity representing a digital asset or point system that users can earn and use within the platform.

virtualCurrencyId.description: Unique identifier for the virtual currency. Must be a non-empty string without spaces, 2-30 characters long.

origin.description: Indicates if the virtual currency originates from a predefined catalog or is custom-created for the workspace.

virtualCurrencyCatalogId.description: If origin is 'CATALOG', this is the ID reference to the original virtual currency in the catalog.

syncWithCatalog.description: If true and origin is 'CATALOG', this virtual currency will be kept in sync with updates from the catalog.

defaultLang.description: The default language code (e.g., 'en', 'it') for the virtual currency's translatable content like label and description.

langs.description: A list of language codes for which translations of this virtual currency are available.

minAllowedBalance.description: Optional minimum balance allowed for this virtual currency for the user. Transactions might be blocked if they would result in the balance falling below this value.

maxAllowedBalance.description: Optional maximum balance allowed for this virtual currency for the user. Transactions might be blocked if they would result in the balance exceeding this value.

accountId.description: The ID of the account that owns this virtual currency.

workspaceId.description: The ID of the workspace to which this virtual currency belongs.

sourceRegion.description: The AWS region where this virtual currency record was created.

stage.description: The current publication stage of the virtual currency. 'DRAFT' means it's not yet active, 'PUBLISHED' means it's available for use.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the virtual currency was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the virtual currency was last updated.

CreateVirtualCurrencyRequest.description: Data required to create a new virtual currency.

name.description: Name of the virtual currency. This is for internal identification and management.

defaultLang.description: The default language code for the virtual currency's translatable content (e.g., label, description).

translations.description: A list of translations for the virtual currency's content. At least one translation (for the defaultLang) must be provided.

UpdateVirtualCurrencyRequest.description: Data required to update an existing virtual currency.

name.description: Updated name of the virtual currency.

defaultLang.description: Updated default language code for the virtual currency's content.

translations.description: Updated list of translations for the virtual currency's content. Ensures all previously supported languages are still covered or explicitly removed.

label.description: The translated display name or label for the virtual currency (e.g., 'Gold Coins', 'Punti Stella').

description.description: The translated description providing more details about the virtual currency.

VirtualTransactionInput.description: Input for a single transaction initiated via the Dashboard API by an admin. If sourceUserId is provided, it's an ADMIN forced user-to-user transfer, otherwise it is a transaction from/to the system to/from the destinationUserId, depending on the amount sign

virtualCurrencyId.description: The ID of the virtual currency to be transacted.

sourceUserId.description: Optional. The ID of the user from whom the currency will be debited. If omitted, the source is considered the SYSTEM.

destinationUserId.description: Optional. The ID of the user to whom the currency will be credited. If omitted, the destination is considered the SYSTEM.

redemptionMode.description: The redemption mode for the transaction.

amount.description: The amount of virtual currency. Must be a positive value. Direction is inferred from source/destination.

expiresAt.description: Optional ISO date-time string. If provided and redemptionMode is MANUAL, the transaction will expire at this time if not completed.

CreateVirtualTransactionsRequest.description: Request body for creating virtual transactions from the Dashboard API.

transactions.description: A list of transaction inputs. Minimum 1 item.

CreateVirtualTransactionsResponse.description: Response body after creating virtual transactions from the Dashboard API.

transactions.description: A list of all created virtual transaction ledger entries.

virtualTransactionId.description: Unique identifier for the virtual transaction.

userId.description: The ID of the User to whom this transaction pertains.

virtualCurrencyId.description: Identifier of the virtual currency involved in the transaction.

amount.description: The amount of virtual currency transacted. Positive for credit, negative for debit (direction field also indicates actual movement).

direction.description: Indicates whether the transaction is a credit or a debit for the user.

state.description: The current state of the transaction. Expired transactions are evaluated lazily and their state is updated when trying to redeem them.

initiator.description: Identifier of the entity that initiated the transaction (e.g., userId, ruleId, system process name).

initiatorType.description: The type of entity that initiated the transaction.

counterpart.description: Identifier of the counterpart in the transaction (e.g., another userId, system entity).

redemptionMode.description: Defines wether the transaction is automatically redeemed or not. If redemptionMode is MANUAL, the transaction will be pending until this transaction (if at credit) or the counterpart transaction (if at debit) is redeemed.

virtualTransactionGroupId.description: Identifier for a group of related transactions that was processed (created) together ad a database transaction.

redemptionGroupId.description: Identifier for a grouping related transactions (credit and debit counterparts) where redemptionMode was MANUAL. When the credit ledger transaction is redeemed, all transactions in the group are redeemed together.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the transaction record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the transaction record was last updated.

redeemedAt.description: Timestamp when the transaction was redeemed (ex, state changed to COMPLETED).

expiresAt.description: Optional Timestamp that reflects the expiration date of the transaction when redemptionMode is MANUAL and state is PENDING. If not provided, the transaction will never expire.
